revision.text:
The '''Marcel Loncin Research Prize''' was established in 1994. It is awarded by the [[Institute of Food Technologists]] (IFT) in even-numbered years to fund basic [[chemistry]], [[physics]], and/or [[engineering]] research applied to [[food processing]] and improving [[food quality]]. It is named for [[Marcel Loncin]] (1920-1994), a [[Belgium|Belgian]]-born, [[France|French]] [[Chemical engineering|chemical engineer]] who did [[food engineering]] research while a professor at the Centre d'Enseignement et de Recherches des Industries Alimentaries (CERIA) and afterwards at the Food Engineering Department of the [[Universität Karlsruhe (TH)]], Germany. It was the third and final IFT award as of 2006 that has been named for a then-living person.
Award winners receive [[USD]] 50,000 in two annual installments and a plaque from the Marcin Loncin Endowment Fund of the IFT.
==Winners==
{| !Year !Winner |- | 1994 | [[Werner Bauer]] |- | 1996 | [[John M.V. Blanshard]] |- | 1998 | [[Theodore P. Labuza]] |- | 2000 | [[Syed S.H. Rizvi]] |- | 2002 | [[Jozef L. Kokini]] |- | 2004 | [[Dietrich Knorr]] |- | 2006 | [[Jose Miguel Aguilera]] |- | 2008 | [[Shelly J. Schmidt]] |- | 2010 | [[D. Julian McClements]] |- | 2014 | [[Lisa J. Mauer]] |- |}
==References== *Mermelstein, N.H. "The Man Behind The Prize." ''Food Technology.'' December 2006. p. 23.
==External links== {{portal|Food}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20061002113952/http://members.ift.org/IFT/Awards/AchievmentAwards/AwardWinners/pastawardwinners.htm List of past winners] - Official site
[[Category:Food technology awards]]

{{Infobox person |name = Meg Whitman |image = Meg Whitman crop.jpg |birth_name = Margaret Cushing Whitman |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|8|4}} |birth_place = [[Huntington, New York|Huntington]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |spouse = [[Griffith R. Harsh|Griffith Harsh]] {{small|(1980–present)}} |children = 2 |education = [[Princeton University]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])}}
[[Harvard University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} |net_worth = [[US$]]3.2 billion{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/meg-whitman |title=Meg Whitman |publisher=[[Forbes]] |accessdate=August 20, 2017}} (2018) }} '''Margaret Cushing''' "'''Meg'''" '''Whitman''' (born August 4, 1956) is an American business executive, political activist, and philanthropist. Whitman served as President and Chief Executive Officer of [[Hewlett Packard Enterprise]]. Whitman was a senior member of [[Mitt Romney]]'s presidential campaigns in both 2008 and 2012 and ran for governor of California as a Republican but supported [[Hillary Clinton]] in 2016. A native of [[Cold Spring Harbor, New York|Cold Spring Harbor]], a hamlet of [[Huntington, New York]], Whitman is a graduate of [[Princeton University]] and [[Harvard Business School]]. Whitman served as an executive in [[The Walt Disney Company]], where she was Vice President of Strategic Planning throughout the 1980s. In the 1990s, she served as an executive for [[DreamWorks]], [[Procter & Gamble]], and [[Hasbro]]. Whitman served as President and Chief Executive Officer of [[eBay]], from 1998 to 2008. During Whitman's 10 years with the company, she oversaw its expansion from 30 employees and $4 million in annual revenue, to more than 15,000 employees and $8 billion in annual revenue. In 2014, Whitman was named 20th in ''Forbes'' List of the 100 Most Powerful Women in the World.{{cite web|title=The World's 100 Most Powerful Women|url=https://www.forbes.com/power-women/list/#tab:overall|website=Forbes|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=24 June 2014}} In 2008, Whitman was cited by ''[[The New York Times]]'' as among the women most likely to become the first female President of the United States.{{cite news |first=Kate |last=Zernike |title=She Just Might Be President Someday |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/18/weekinreview/18zernike.html |work=New York Times |date=May 18, 2008 }} In February 2009, Whitman announced her candidacy for [[Governor of California]], becoming the third woman in a 20-year period to run for the office. Whitman won the Republican primary in June 2010. The fifth-wealthiest woman in California with a net worth of $1.3 billion in 2010,{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Margaret-Whitman_5AW7.html |title=#773 Margaret Whitman |work=Forbes|date=February 12, 2010 |accessdate=August 29, 2010}} she spent more of her own money on the race than any other political candidate spent on a single election in American history,{{cite news|author=York, Anthony|title=Whitman becomes biggest-spending candidate on a single campaign in U.S. history [Updated]|date=September 15, 2010 |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/california-politics/2010/09/whitman-becomes-biggest-spender-in-american-political-history.html|work=The Los Angeles Times|publisher=Tribune Company|accessdate=November 1, 2011}}{{cite news|last=Cha|first=Ariana Eunjung|title=Former eBay CEO Meg Whitman breaks campaign financing records with $119 million contribution|url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/political-economy/2010/09/former_ebay_ceo_meg_whitman_br.html|accessdate=October 4, 2010|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=September 16, 2010}} spending $144 million of her own fortune and $178.5 million in total, including money from donors.{{cite news|agency=Associated Press|title=Final Meg Whitman tally: $178.5M|date=January 11, 2011|url=http://www.salon.com/2011/02/01/us_calif_governor_s_race/|work=Salon|accessdate=May 1, 2011}} Whitman was defeated by Democratic former Governor [[Jerry Brown]] in the [[California gubernatorial election, 2010|2010 California gubernatorial election]] by 54% to 41%.{{cite news |first=Philip |last=Caulfield |title=Meg Whitman loses California governor race despite $160 million tab; Jerry Brown wins for 3rd time |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/2010/11/03/2010-11-03_meg_whitman_loses_california_governor_race_despite_140_million_tab_jerry_brown_w.html |work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|location=New York|date=November 3, 2010 |accessdate=November 4, 2010}} ==Early life and education== Whitman was born in [[Cold Spring Harbor, New York]], the daughter of Margaret Cushing (née Goodhue) and Hendricks Hallett Whitman, Jr.{{Cite book|title = Modern management: adding digital focus | last= Certo| first=Samuel C.| publisher=Prentice Hall|date = February 15, 2002 | page = 22| isbn= 978-0-13-067089-2}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1980/04/20/archives/meg-whitman-to-wed-june-7.html|work=The New York Times|title=Meg Whitman to Wed June 7|accessdate=May 12, 2010}}{{cite news| url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/boston/access/2057724392.html?FMT=CITE&FMTS=CITE:AI&type=historic&date=Jun+22%2C+1947&author=&pub=Daily+Boston+Globe+(1928-1960)&desc=Marriage+Announcement+16+--+No+Title&pqatl=google | work=Daily Boston Globe | title=Marriage Announcement 16 -- No Title | date=June 22, 1947}} Her patrilineal great-great-great-grandfather, [[Elnathan Whitman]], was a member of the [[Nova Scotia House of Assembly]]. Through her father, Whitman is also a great-great-granddaughter of U.S. Senator [[Charles B. Farwell]], of Illinois.[http://freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~battle/celeb/megwhitman.htm "Margaret Cushing 'Meg' Whitman"], ''rootsweb.ancestry.com''. On her mother's side, she is a great-granddaughter of historian and jurist [[Munroe Smith]] and a great-great-granddaughter of General [[Henry S. Huidekoper]]. Her paternal grandmother, born Adelaide Chatfield-Taylor, was the daughter of writer [[Hobart Chatfield-Taylor]] and the sister of economist [[Wayne Chatfield-Taylor]]. Whitman attended [[Cold Spring Harbor Jr./Sr. High School|Cold Spring Harbor High School]] in [[Cold Spring Harbor, New York]], graduating after three years in 1974. In her memoirs, she says she was in the top 10 of her class.{{Cite book|title = The Power of Many: Values for Success in Business and in Life | last=Whitman|last2=Hamilton| first=Meg|first2=Joan| publisher=Crown Publishing Group|date = January 2010| page = 75| isbn= 978-0-307-59121-0}} She wanted to be a doctor, so she studied math and science at [[Princeton University]].{{cite news|url=http://www.notablebiographies.com/news/Sh-Z/Whitman-Meg.html|work=Encyclopedia of World Biography|title=Meg Whitman Biography|accessdate=September 30, 2010}} However, after spending a summer selling advertisements for a magazine, she changed over to the study of economics,{{Cite book|title = The Ebay Phenomenon: The Story of a Brand That Taught Millions of Strangers to Trust One Another| last=Lewis| first=Elen| publisher=Marshall Cavendish |year = 2008| page = 55 | isbn=978-1-905736-10-2 }} earning a B.A. with honors in 1977. Whitman then obtained an [[Master of Business Administration|M.B.A.]] from [[Harvard Business School]] in 1979.{{Cite book|title = The Promotable Woman | last=Carr-Ruffino | first=Norma | publisher=Career Press, Incorporated|date = October 2004 | page = 76| isbn=978-1-56414-776-9}} Whitman is married to [[Griffith R. Harsh|Griffith Harsh IV]], a neurosurgeon at [[Stanford University Medical Center]].{{Cite book|title = The Perfect Store: Inside EBay | last=Cohen| first=Adam| publisher=Little, Brown & Company|year = 2003| page = 112 | isbn=978-0-316-16493-1 }} They have two sons. She has lived in [[Atherton, California]], since March 1998.{{cite web |first=Mark |last=Berniker |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2014/05/09/ |title=Atherton mansion madness: Homes of the rich and (tech) famous |publisher=CNBC |date=May 9, 2014 |accessdate=May 8, 2016 }}{{Dead link|date=August 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} [[Whitman College, Princeton University|Whitman College]], a [[residential college]] completed in 2007 at [[Princeton University]], was named for Meg Whitman following her $30 million donation.{{Cite news| url =http://www.zdnet.com/article/ebay-ceo-gives-30m-to-princeton/|title= eBay CEO gives $30m to Princeton|first=Joey |last=Gardiner|publisher=[[ZDNet]] |date = February 5, 2002}} ==Career== ===Early work=== Beginning her career in 1979 as a brand manager at [[Procter & Gamble]] in [[Cincinnati]], Ohio. Whitman later moved on to work as a consultant at [[Bain & Company]]'s San Francisco office. She then rose through the ranks to achieve the position of senior vice president.{{Cite book|title=Organizational behavior|last=Hellriegel, Slocum|first=Don, John W.|publisher=Princeton, N.J. : Recording for the Blind & Dyslexic|year=2008|pages=NA}} Whitman became vice president of strategic planning at [[The Walt Disney Company]] in 1989. Two years later she joined the [[Stride Rite Corporation]], before becoming president and CEO of [[Florists' Transworld Delivery]] in 1995.{{Cite book|title = The Ebay Phenomenon: The Story of a Brand That Taught Millions of Strangers to Trust One Another| last=Lewis| first=Elen| publisher=Marshall Cavendish |year = 2008| page = 56 | isbn=978-1-905736-10-2 }} As [[Hasbro]]'s Playskool Division General Manager, she oversaw global management and marketing of two children's brands, [[Playskool]] and [[Mr. Potato Head]] starting in January 1997. She also imported the UK's children's television show [[Teletubbies]] into the U.S.{{Cite book|title=Strategic management: awareness and change|last=John, Frank|first=Thompson Martin|publisher=Cengage Learning EMEA|year=2005|page=201|isbn=978-1-84480-083-4}} ===eBay=== Whitman joined [[eBay]] in March 1998, when it had 30 employees{{cite news|author=Thomas, Owen|title=eBay founder fact checks John McCain|url=http://valleywag.com/5060675/ebay-founder-factchecks-john-mccain|date=October 8, 2009|work=Valleywag|publisher=Gawker Media|accessdate=March 4, 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081009161536/http://valleywag.com/5060675/ebay-founder-factchecks-john-mccain|archivedate=October 9, 2008|df=mdy-all}} and revenues of approximately $4 million. During her time as CEO, the company grew to approximately 15,000 employees and $8 billion in annual revenue by 2008."Meg Whitman right for job". ''Santa Maria Times''. December 9, 2009 Originally, when Whitman had joined eBay, she found the website as a simple black and white webpage with [[Courier (typeface)|courier font]]. On her first day, the site crashed for eight hours.{{Cite book|title=The arc of ambition: defining the leadership journey|last=Champy, Nohria|first=James, Nitin|publisher=Basic Books|year=1999|page=95|isbn=978-0-7382-0103-0}} She believed the site to be confusing and began by building a new executive team. Whitman organized the company by splitting it into twenty-three business categories. She then assigned executives to each, including some 35,000 subcategories.{{Cite book|title=Managing Now|last=Dessler, Phillips|first=Gary, Jean|publisher=Cengage Learning|year=2007|page=6|isbn=978-0-618-74163-2}} In 2004, Whitman made several key changes in her management team. [[Jeff Jordan (venture capitalist)|Jeff Jordan]] took over [[PayPal]], Matt Bannick took control of international operations and Bill Cobb was placed in control of U.S. operations,{{Cite book|title=Strategic management: competitiveness and globalization|last=Michael, Duane, Robert|first=Hitt, Ireland, Hoskisson|publisher=Cengage South-Western|year=2006|page=82|isbn=978-0-324-31694-0}} which has the colorful U.S. logo, while each international site has unique branding.{{Cite book|title=The Official eBay Bible: The Newly Revised and Updated Version of the Most Comprehensive eBay How-To Manual for Everyone from First-Time Users to eBay Experts|last=Griffith|first=Jim|publisher=Penguin Group (USA)|year=2007|page=257|isbn=978-1-59240-301-1}} [[File:EBay former logo.svg|200px|thumb|right|eBay's logo prior to Sept 2012.]] Whitman picked John J. Donahoe for eBay in March 2005{{cite web|url=http://legacy.ebayinc.com/executives |title=eBay Inc. Leadership |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130701052554/http://legacy.ebayinc.com/executives |archivedate=July 1, 2013 |df=mdy }} as President of eBay Marketplaces, responsible for all elements of eBay's global ecommerce businesses. During Whitman's tenure as CEO, eBay completed the purchase of [[Skype]] for $4.1B in cash and stock in September 2005.{{cite web |first=Michael |last=Arrington |title=Skype sells to eBay for $4.1 Billion |url=https://techcrunch.com/2005/09/12/skype-sells-to-ebay-for-41-billion |publisher=[[TechCrunch]] |date=September 12, 2005 |accessdate=November 3, 2010}} eBay later admitted that it had overpaid and, in 2009, eBay sold Skype to a group of investors led by [[Silver Lake Partners]] at a valuation of $2.75B.{{cite web |first=Robin |last=Wauters |title=Breaking: eBay Completes Skype Sale At $2.75 Billion Valuation |url=https://techcrunch.com/2009/11/19/ebay-skype-sale/ |publisher=TechCrunch |date=November 19, 2009 |accessdate=November 3, 2010}}{{cite web |title=Microsoft to acquire Skype for $8.5 billion |url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13506_3-20061371-17.html?tag=mncol;txt |publisher=[[CNET]] |date=May 10, 2011}} In 2011, after the first papers were filed for a possible IPO, Microsoft purchased Skype for US$8.5B. In June 2007, while preparing for an interview with [[Reuters]], Whitman allegedly shoved her subordinate, communications employee Young Mi Kim. Of the incident, Whitman related, "In any high-pressure working environment, tensions can surface." Kim also stated, "Yes, we had an unfortunate incident, but we resolved it in a way that speaks well for her and for eBay." The matter was resolved after a $200,000 settlement.Mehta, Seema (June 15, 2010). [http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-0615-whitman-20100615,0,3139793.story "Meg Whitman reportedly shoved EBay employee in 2007"]. ''Los Angeles Times''.[[Brad Stone (journalist)|Stone, Brad]] (June 14, 2010). [https://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/15/us/politics/15whitman.html?scp=2&sq=whitman&st=cse "Settlement Was Paid in Whitman Shoving Incident"]. ''[[The New York Times]]''. Whitman resigned as CEO of eBay in November 2007, but remained on the board and served as an advisor to new CEO [[John Donahoe]] until late 2008. She was inducted into the U.S. Business Hall of Fame in 2008. "I've said for some time that 10 years is roughly the right time to stay at the helm at a company like ours", she said in an interview with the ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]'', adding that "it's time for new leadership, a new perspective and a new vision."{{cite news|title=Whitman quits eBay CEO post as of March 31|first=Verne|last=Kopytoff|work=San Francisco Chronicle|date=January 24, 2008}} Whitman has received numerous awards and accolades for her work at eBay. On more than one occasion, she was named among the top five most powerful women by ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' magazine.{{cite news|title=The Power 50|url=http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2007/fortune/0709/gallery.women_mostpowerful.fortune/3.html|work=Fortune|first1=Katie|last1=Benner|first2=Eugenia|last2=Levinson|first3=Rupali|last3=Arora|accessdate=May 12, 2010}} ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'' named her the eighth-best-performing CEO of the past decade{{cite news|title=The 100 Best-Performing CEOs in the World|work=Harvard Business Review|date=January 2010|url=http://hbr.org/web/extras/100ceos/8-whitman|accessdate=January 7, 2010}} and the ''[[Financial Times]]'' named her as one of the 50 faces that shaped the decade.{{cite news|title=Fifty Faces That Shaped The Decade|work=Financial Times|date=December 16, 2009|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/32e550e8-efd4-11de-833d-00144feab49a,Authorised=false.html?_i_location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ft.com%2Fcms%2Fs%2F0%2F32e550e8-efd4-11de-833d-00144feab49a.html%3Fnclick_check%3D1&_i_referer=&nclick_check=1|accessdate=January 7, 2010}} ===Boards=== Whitman also served on the board of directors of the eBay Foundation, Summit Public Schools, Procter & Gamble and [[DreamWorks SKG]], until early 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.referenceforbusiness.com/biography/S-Z/Whitman-Meg-1956.html|title=Meg Whitman Business Biography|publisher=Referenceforbusiness.com|accessdate=May 27, 2010}}{{cite news|author=Lifsher, Marc|title=Ex-EBay chief Meg Whitman quits board seats|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-whitman6-2009jan06,0,5142789.story|date=January 6, 2009|work=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=February 22, 2009}} She was appointed to the board of [[Goldman Sachs]] in October 2001 and then resigned in December 2002, amidst controversy that she had received shares in several [[public offerings]] managed by Goldman Sachs, although she denied any wrongdoing.{{cite web|last1=Williams|first1=Lance|last2=Marinucci|first2=Carla|title=Whitman's fortune entwined with Goldman Sachs|url=http://californiawatch.org/money-and-politics/whitmans-fortune-entwined-goldman-sachs|publisher=California Watch|accessdate=7 August 2014|date=August 10, 2010|quote=During the 2002 IPO "spinning" controversy, Whitman denied wrongdoing, telling eBay employees in a memo that Goldman had offered her stock deals because she was a private client of the firm, not in exchange for eBay's bond business.|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727180118/http://californiawatch.org/money-and-politics/whitmans-fortune-entwined-goldman-sachs|archive-date=27 July 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|title=Meg Whitman joins Goldman Sachs' Board of Directors|url=http://www.bain.dk/bainweb/publications/publications_detail.asp?id=3989&menu_url=publications_results.asp.story|date=October 1, 2001|publisher=Bain & Company|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719120702/http://www.bain.dk/bainweb/publications/publications_detail.asp?id=3989&menu_url=publications_results.asp.story|archivedate=July 19, 2011|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news|author=Kane, Margaret|title=Whitman resigns from Goldman Sachs board|url=http://news.cnet.com/Whitman-resigns-from-Goldman-Sachs-board/2110-1017_3-978561.html.story|date=December 20, 2002|work=cnet.com}}{{cite news|first=Lance|last=Williams|first2=Carla|last2=Marinucci|title=Whitman's fortune entwined with Goldman Sachs|url=http://californiawatch.org/money-and-politics/whitmans-fortune-entwined-goldman-sachs|date=April 10, 2010|work=californiawatch.org|access-date=August 7, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727180118/http://californiawatch.org/money-and-politics/whitmans-fortune-entwined-goldman-sachs|archive-date=July 27, 2014|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} (see [[#Ties to Goldman Sachs|Ties to Goldman Sachs]] for further detail). In March 2011, she was appointed a part-time special adviser at venture capital firm [[Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers]].Kopytoff, Verne G. (March 30, 2011). [http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/03/30/meg-whitman-finds-a-job/ "Meg Whitman Finds a Job"]. ''The New York Times''. Retrieved September 23, 2011. She has also joined the boards of [[Zipcar]]{{cite press release|last=Winter|first=Greg|title=Zipcar adds former eBay CEO Meg Whitman to its board of directors|url=http://zipcar.mediaroom.com/index.php?s=43&item=215|publisher=Zipcar|accessdate=September 23, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110407014229/http://zipcar.mediaroom.com/index.php?s=43&item=215|archivedate=April 7, 2011|df=mdy-all}} and [[Teach For America]], and re-joined the board of Procter & Gamble.{{Cite news| url =http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/02/11/meg-whitman-rejoins-procter-gamble_n_822192.html|title= Meg Whitman Rejoins Procter & Gamble's Board|first=Dan|last= Sewell |publisher=[[The Huffington Post]] |date = February 11, 2011}} Whitman has also been a member of the board at [[Survey Monkey]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/news/2017/05/24/meg-whitman-serena-williams-surveymonkey-board.html|title=Meg Whitman out, Serena Williams in as SurveyMonkey directors|last=Schubarth|first=Cromwell|date=|website=|access-date=2017-06-01}} and [[Immortals (eSports)|Immortals]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/former-ebay-hp-chief-whitman-invests-in-esports-startup-1532388794|title=Former eBay, HP Chief Whitman Invests in Esports Startup|last=Farrell|first=Maureen|date=2018-07-23|work=Wall Street Journal|access-date=2018-07-24|language=en-US|issn=0099-9660}} ===Hewlett-Packard=== In January 2011, Whitman joined Hewlett-Packard's (HP) board of directors.{{Cite news| url = http://www.ocregister.com/totalbuzz/strong-468435-whitman-hurd.html |title=Meg Whitman goes back to work|first=Martin|last= Wisckol|publisher=[[Orange County Register]] |date =January 21, 2011}} She was named CEO on September 22, 2011.{{cite press release|title=HP Names Meg Whitman President and Chief Executive Officer|url=http://www.hp.com/hpinfo/newsroom/press/2011/110922xb.html?mtxs=rss-corp-news|date=September 22, 2011|publisher=[[Hewlett-Packard]]|accessdate=September 22, 2011}} As well as renewing focus on HP's Research & Development division, Whitman's major decision during her first year as CEO has been to retain and recommit the firm to the [[Personal computer|PC]] business that her predecessor announced he was considering discarding.{{cite web|url=http://www.thomaswhite.com/global-perspectives/meg-whitman-ceo-hp/ |title=Global Players: Meg Whitman, CEO, HP|publisher=Thomaswhite.com |accessdate=2012-02-21}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.boston.com/2012-02-21/business/31083792_1_pc-business-leo-apotheker-hp-plans |title=HP's 4Q to provide snapshot of new CEO's progress |publisher=Boston.com |accessdate=2012-02-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120723182122/http://articles.boston.com/2012-02-21/business/31083792_1_pc-business-leo-apotheker-hp-plans |archivedate=July 23, 2012 }} In May 2013, [[Bloomberg L.P.]] named Whitman "Most Underachieving CEO" along with [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s CEO [[Tim Cook]] (ranked 12th) and [[IBM]]'s [[Virginia Rometty]] (ranked 10th) -- whose stocks have all turned in the worst numbers relative to the broader market since the beginning of each CEO's tenure. HP's stock led the list by underperforming by 30 percentage points since Whitman took the job.{{cite news| url=https://www.bloomberg.com/visual-data/best-and-worst/biggest-ceo-underachievers-executives | publisher=Bloomberg | title=Biggest CEO Underachievers: Executives - Bloomberg Best (and Worst)}} On July 26, 2017, Whitman stepped down as Chairwoman of HP Inc.'s board of directors, while remaining as CEO of Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE).{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/07/26/meg-whitman-steps-down-from-hp-board.html|title=Meg Whitman steps down from HP board|last=Novet|first=Jordan|date=2017-07-26|access-date=2017-07-28}} Whitman fought off further rumours around her position at HPE, where she was quoted by ''[[The New York Times]]'' "So let me make this as clear as I can. I am fully committed to HPE and plan to remain the company's C.E.O. We have a lot of work still to do at HPE and I am not going anywhere" https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/27/technology/ubers-next-ceo-meg-whitman-says-it-wont-be-her.html On November 21, 2017 it was announced Whitman was stepping aside as the CEO of HPE effectively February 1, 2018 with HPE president Antonio Neri taking over as CEO.{{Cite news|url=http://fortune.com/2017/11/21/meg-whitman-hewlett-packard-enterprise-ceo/|title=Here's why HPE CEO Meg Whitman is stepping down|work=Fortune|access-date=2018-04-04|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hpe-results/meg-whitman-stepping-down-as-hp-enterprise-ceo-idUSKBN1DL2PO|title=Meg Whitman stepping down as HP Enterprise CEO|last=Aripaka|first=Pushkala|work=U.S.|access-date=2018-04-04|language=en-US}} ==Charitable foundation== {{main|Griffith R. Harsh IV and Margaret C Whitman Charitable Foundation}} Whitman founded a charitable foundation with husband Harsh on December 21, 2006, by donating to it 300,000 shares of eBay stock worth $9.4 million.{{cite news |title=Former eBay CEO Meg Whitman Launches Family Foundation |first=Ina|last= Steiner |newspaper=AuctionBytes.com |date=May 12, 2008 |url=http://www.auctionbytes.com/cab/abn/y08/m05/i12/s03 |accessdate=August 14, 2010}} By the end of its first year of operation, the Griffith R. Harsh IV and Margaret C Whitman Charitable Foundation had $46 million in assets and has disbursed $125,000 to charitable causes. Most of the money disbursed went to the [[Environmental Defense Fund]].{{cite news |title=Meg Whitman's charitable foundation's biggest benefactor was environmental group |author=McLaughlin, Ken |newspaper=[[San Jose Mercury News]] |date=November 7, 2009 }} In 2010, [[Warren Buffett]] asked Whitman to join the [[Giving Pledge]] in which billionaires would commit to donating half of their money to charity, and Whitman declined.{{cite news |title=Whitman: No plans to join billionaires' pledge |first=Samantha |last= Young |newspaper=[[San Jose Mercury News]] |date=August 5, 2010 |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/2010/08/05/whitman-no-plans-to-join-billionaires-pledge/ |accessdate=August 14, 2010}} In 2011, the foundation donated $2.5 million to [[Summit Public Schools]], which operates several [[Charter schools in the United States|charter schools]] in the San Jose area.{{Cite news| url =http://abc7news.com/archive/8362142/|title=Whitman gives $2.5M to Summit Schools|first =Lyanne |last=Melendez |publisher=[[KGO-TV]] |date =September 20, 2011 }} ==Political career== ===Presidential endorsements and fundraising=== Whitman was a supporter of former [[Massachusetts]] Governor [[Mitt Romney presidential campaign, 2008|Mitt Romney's presidential campaign in 2008]]{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21407008/page/2/|title=MTP transcript for October 21, 2007 - Meet the Press, online at MSNBC |publisher=MSNBC|date=October 21, 2007|accessdate=May 27, 2010}} and was on his national finance team.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/04/03/us/politics/03money.html?ex=1177905600&en=3820b87532ea5dc6&ei=5070|work=The New York Times|title=Romney Reaps $20 Million to Top G.O.P. Rivals|first=David D.|last=Kirkpatrick|date=April 3, 2007|accessdate=May 12, 2010}} She was also listed as finance co-chair of Romney's [[exploratory committee]].{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/ELECTION/2008/candidates/mitt.romney.html|publisher=CNN|title=Election Center 2008: Candidates - Election & Politics News from CNN.com|accessdate=May 12, 2010}} After Romney stepped out of the race and endorsed [[John McCain]], Whitman joined McCain's presidential campaign as a national co-chair.{{cite web |url=http://www.johnmccain.com/Informing/News/PressReleases/481e9209-2ea4-4069-ada6-d66b4301f0f9.htm |title=hn McCain 2008 – John McCain for President |publisher=Johnmccain.com |accessdate=May 27, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101114094511/http://www.johnmccain.com/Informing/News/PressReleases/481e9209-2ea4-4069-ada6-d66b4301f0f9.htm |archivedate=November 14, 2010 |df= }} McCain mentioned Whitman as a possible [[United States Secretary of the Treasury|Secretary of the Treasury]] during the [[United States presidential debates, 2008|second presidential debate]] in 2008,[https://www.reuters.com/article/politicsNews/idUSTRE4970PR20081008 "McCain, Obama discuss possible Treasury secretary picks"]. Reuters. October 7, 2008. Retrieved October 8, 2008. but lost the election to [[Barack Obama]]. During the 2012 Republican primaries, Whitman endorsed Mitt Romney,Quinn, Michelle, [http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0512/76870.html "Whitman a mixed blessing for Mitt"], ''politico.com'', May 30, 2012. who praised her.[http://www.addictinginfo.org/2012/05/20/mitt-romney-praises-meg-whitman-as-news-breaks-that-her-company-is-slashing-30000-american-jobs/ "mitt-romney-praises-meg-whitman-as-news-breaks-that-her-company-is-slashing-30000-american-jobs"], ''[[addictinginfo.org]]'', May 20, 2012. Whitman's name was mentioned as a possible cabinet member in a Romney administration[http://mobile.eweek.com/c/a/IT-Infrastructure/HP-CEO-Whitman-Fiorina-Seen-as-Possible-Officials-in-a-Romney-Administration-113758/ "HP-CEO-Whitman-Fiorina-Seen-as-Possible-Officials-in-a-Romney-Administration"]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, ''eweek.com''. before he lost to Obama. During the [[Republican Party presidential primaries, 2016|2016 Republican primaries]], Whitman was finance co-chair of [[Chris Christie presidential campaign, 2016|Chris Christie's presidential campaign]]. After Christie withdrew from the race and subsequently endorsed [[Donald Trump]], Whitman criticized it as "an astonishing display of political opportunism" and called on other Christie donors to reject Trump,[http://www.nbcnews.com/meet-the-press/christie-campaign-s-finance-co-chair-calls-donors-reject-trump-n527451 Christie Campaign's Finance Co-Chair Calls on Donors to Reject Trump], ''nbcnews.com'', February 28, 2016 whom she compared to [[Adolf Hitler]] and [[Benito Mussolini]].{{cite news|author= |title=Meg Whitman Likens Donald Trump to Fascists, Shaking G.O.P.'s Brief Truce |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/12/us/politics/meg-whitman-likens-donald-trump-to-fascists-at-republican-retreat.html |date=June 11, 2016 |work=NYT |accessdate=July 22, 2016}} In August, Whitman endorsed Democrat [[Hillary Clinton]]'s [[Hillary Clinton presidential campaign, 2016|presidential campaign]], stating that to vote for Trump "out of party loyalty alone would be to endorse a candidacy that I believe has exploited anger, grievance, xenophobia and racial division". Acknowledging policy differences with Clinton, Whitman nonetheless praised her "temperament, global experience and commitment to America's bedrock national values".{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/03/us/politics/meg-whitman-hillary-clinton.html|title=Meg Whitman, Calling Donald Trump a 'Demagogue,' Will Support Hillary Clinton for President|last=Martin|first=Jonathan|date=2 August 2016|work=The New York Times|accessdate=3 August 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/08/02/politics/meg-whitman-hillary-clinton-endorsement/|title=Meg Whitman: I will vote for, and donate to, Hillary Clinton|author=Eli Watkins|date=3 August 2016|work=CNN|accessdate=3 August 2016}}{{cite news|url=https://www.facebook.com/megwhitman/posts/10154387280890477|title=As a proud Republican...|author=Meg Whitman|date=2 August 2016|work=Facebook|accessdate=3 August 2016}} She called on all Republicans "to put country first before party" and added that she would support the campaign financially. ===2010 campaign for California Governor=== {{Main|California gubernatorial election, 2010}} [[File:Meg Whitman 2010 Sign.jpg|thumb|right|Whitman's campaign sign for Governor of California]] On February 10, 2009, Whitman announced she would run for governor of California in the 2010 election.{{cite news|author=Finnegan, Michael|title=Meg Whitman, EBay's former CEO, joins California governor's race|date=February 10, 2009|work=Los Angeles Times|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2009/feb/10/local/me-whitman10|accessdate=2009-10-10}} Her campaign was largely self-funded. She spent more of her own money on this effort than any other self-funded political candidate in U.S. history and ultimately lost to [[Jerry Brown]]. According to final reports, Whitman spent $144 million from her own personal funds.{{cite news|title=Final Meg Whitman tally: $178.5M|url=http://www.salon.com/news/feature/2011/01/31/us_calif_governor_s_race|date=January 31, 2011|work=Salon|accessdate=September 7, 2011}} ''[[The Daily Caller]]'' said that her "penchant for throwing money around is well known in California political circles". The comment came in connection with the disclosure that her campaign had paid far above market rates for advertising on a conservative political blog. The blog's founder, addressing the issue of a possible attempt to influence the blog's content, said he had made clear to the Whitman campaign that "advertising and editorial are two very different things".{{cite web| last = Strong| first = Jonathan | title = True stories of bloggers who secretly feed on partisan cash| work=[[The Daily Caller]]| date = August 23, 2010| url = http://dailycaller.com/2010/08/23/true-stories-of-bloggers-who-secretly-feed-on-partisan-cash/| accessdate =August 28, 2010}} In June 2010, Whitman released a political ad, "A Lifetime in Politics A Legacy of Failure",{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAkTfwN39us|title=Jerry Brown: A Lifetime in Politics, A Legacy of Failure|date=June 22, 2010|publisher=Meg Whitman for Governor 2010 via YouTube|accessdate=October 31, 2010}} which seemingly contained one image of the [[Fail blog|FAIL Blog]] website, making it appear in the ad as if Jerry Brown had been the subject of one of the website's namesake "fails".[http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2010/06/meg_whitmans_failblog_fail.html "Meg Whitman's FAIL Blog FAIL"]. ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]''. June 25, 2010. Ben Huh, founder of the [[Cheezburger Network]], of which failblog.org is a part, demanded an apology and the removal of the video, stating that the image was faked, and that the website is non-partisan and has never endorsed a particular political candidate or party.{{cite web|url=http://failblog.org/2010/06/25/honesty-fail-2/ |title=Honesty Fail – FAIL Blog: Epic Fail Funny Pictures and Funny Videos of Owned, Pwned and Fail Moments |publisher=FAIL Blog |date=June 25, 2010 |accessdate=August 29, 2010}} On November 2, 2010, at 11:35 pm, Whitman conceded the election to her opponent, Jerry Brown, stating "We've come up a little short."{{cite news | url=https://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2010/11/03/meg-whitman-concedes-in-california-race/| title=Meg Whitman Concedes in California Race.| accessdate=March 11, 2010|work=The Wall Street Journal}} ====Voting record==== In 2010, ''[[The Sacramento Bee]]'' reported that Whitman did not vote for 28 years, after reviewing her voting records in California.{{Cite news| url =http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/meg-whitman-loses-california-governor-race-160-million-tab-jerry-brown-wins-3rd-time-article-1.450512 |title=Meg Whitman loses California governor race despite $160 million tab; Jerry Brown wins for 3rd time|first=Philip |last=Caulfield |publisher=[[Daily News (New York)]] |date =November 3, 2010}} Whitman has described her voting record as "inexcusable", apologized for it, and stated that she is happy to discuss the matter.{{cite news|author=Cillizza, Chris|title=CA-Gov: Whitman Defends Handling of Vote Story|date=October 10, 2009|work=The Washington Post|url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/thefix/governors/ca-gov-whitman-defends-handlin.html|accessdate=2009-10-10}} Whitman answered questions about her record in September, replying, "And I think the reason {{sic|hide=y|is,| is}} for many years, I wasn't as engaged in the political process and should have been."{{cite news|author=Riggs, Kevin|title=Whitman Explains Poor Voting Record|url=http://www.kcra.com/politics/21150728/detail.html|date=September 29, 2010|publisher=Hearst|work=KCRA.com|accessdate=October 19, 2010}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ====Housekeeper controversy==== In September 2010, Nicky Diaz Santillan revealed that she was employed in the Whitman household as a housekeeper and nanny from 2000–2009 despite her status as an illegal worker.Carla Marinucci, ''San Francisco Chronicle'', October 10, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.ilw.com/gregsiskind/2010/10/whitman-nanny-i-9-shows-violations.html |title=Greg Siskind on Immigration Law and Policy: Whitman Nanny I-9 Shows Violations|publisher=American Immigration LLC, ILW.com|date=October 1, 2010 |accessdate=October 25, 2010}} Whitman's campaign released documents which she says Santillan provided prior to her employment including a driver's license, social security ID, and application.{{cite news|author=From Alan Duke and Jessica Yellin, CNN |url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/POLITICS/09/29/whitman.allegations/ |title=Immigrant's abuse claims against Whitman rock California race |publisher=CNN|date= September 29, 2010|accessdate=October 3, 2010}} Santillan says Whitman knew she was undocumented, producing a 2003 letter from the Social Security Administration stating that her Social Security number did not match her name. Whitman initially stated that they "never received those letters",{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20018137-503544.html?tag=contentMain;contentBody|title=Whitman Goes on Defense About Ex-Maid's Status; Gloria Allred Promises to Prove Otherwise|publisher=cbsnews.com | first=Lucy|last=Madison|date=September 30, 2010}} however, after a hand-written note on the document was shown, believed to be from [[Griffith R. Harsh|Whitman's husband]], they acknowledged they may have received it, but forgot.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/01/us/politics/01whitman.html | work=The New York Times | first=Adam | last=Nagourney | title=Questions on Ex-Housekeeper Emerge for a Candidate | date=September 30, 2010}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20018252-503544.html |title=Meg Whitman's Husband: It's 'Possible' I Saw Letter |publisher=CBS News|date=October 1, 2010 |accessdate=October 1, 2010 |first=Lucy |last=Madison}} Santillan's attorney, [[Gloria Allred]], states that Santillan was fired for the sake of the campaign.Michael Winter, [http://content.usatoday.com/communities/ondeadline/post/2010/09/ex-nanny-alleges-meg-whitman-knew-she-wasnt-legal-for-7-years/1 "Ex-nanny alleges Meg Whitman knew she wasn't legal for 7 years"], ''USA Today'', September 29, 2010. Whitman's campaign maintains that this is a political attack, stating that Allred is a [[Jerry Brown]] supporter.{{cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2010/09/29/MNHK1FLKLF.DTL&feed=rss.news |title=Whitman says illegal-worker allegations a 'lie' |work=San Francisco Chronicle |date=February 25, 2010 |accessdate=September 30, 2010 |first1=Carla |last1=Marinucci |first2=John |last2=Wildermuth |first3=Joe |last3=Garofoli}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/politics/Meg-Whitman-Illegal-Immigrant--104020663.html |title=Whitman: 'We Did Everything That We Could' |publisher=NBC Los Angeles |accessdate=October 3, 2010}} Brown, Allred and Santillan all deny this.George Skelton, [http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-cap-20101004,0,2528152,full.column "The Former EBay Chief Falters on Her Illegal Immigration Rhetoric"], ''Los Angeles Times'', October 4, 2010. Crystal Williams, Director of the American Immigration Lawyers Association stated "Not only is accepting the documents all the law required [Whitman] to do, but there's a counterbalancing anti-discrimination law that keeps her from probing further or demanding different documents."{{cite news|first=Carolyn |last=Lochhead|publisher=Chronicle Washington Bureau |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2010/09/30/MN931FME32.DTL#ixzz11FZtZTsZ |title=Whitman within law, immigration lawyers say |work=San Francisco Chronicle |date=February 25, 2010 |accessdate=October 3, 2010}} Others disagree; Immigration lawyer Greg Siskind states Whitman was the employer, and the documents by law needed to be signed by her but were not, nor did they have a social security number on them; the ''Fort Worth Star-Telegram'' noted that Whitman "hired her, paid her and had direct contact with her for nine years", so should have known her legal status.Ruben Naverrette Jr., "[http://jacksonville.com/opinion/blog/406107/carol-boone/2010-10-13/ruben-navarrette-jr-immigration-double-standard Immigration Double Standard]", ''Fort Worth Star-Telegram'', October 17, 2010. The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' noted that Latino voters were more likely interested that Whitman treated Santillan "like a piece of garbage" when the maid asked for help finding an immigration attorney, and Whitman allegedly stated "you don't know me and I don't know you".Brian Montopoli (September 29, 2010), [http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20018055-503544.html "Meg Whitman Housekeeper Nicky Diaz Santillan Claims Mistreatment, Unfair Termination"], CBS News ====Ties to Goldman Sachs==== [[Goldman Sachs]], whose executives donated $100,000 to the Whitman campaign, manages a part of Whitman's fortune. As CEO of eBay, Whitman earned approximately $1.78 million resulting from a practice known as [[spinning (IPO)|spinning]] whereby executives who did business with Goldman Sachs could reap profits by getting early deals before the public on hot IPOs offered by the bank. Whitman later resigned from the Goldman Sachs board after some expressed concern over her receiving shares from Goldman Sachs. In commenting on Whitman's resignation from the Goldman Sachs board, eBay spokesman Henry Gomez told ''The Wall Street Journal'' at the time that, "If we wanted to use Goldman's services, she doesn't want there to be even the slightest perception of any conflict. She's doing this because she thinks quite highly of the firm."{{cite web|title=EBay CEO quits Goldman board|url=http://money.cnn.com/2002/12/20/news/whitman/|publisher=CNN Money|accessdate=7 August 2014|date=December 20, 2002}} While Whitman was on Goldman Sachs' board, she served on the compensation committee, which approved multimillion-dollar bonus packages for then-CEO [[Henry Paulson]] and his top aides. Public domain documents reveal that Whitman has a multimillion-dollar stake in 21 investment funds managed by Goldman Sachs. Given Goldman Sachs' major investments in California state finances, all these ties to Goldman Sachs led to considerable controversy during the gubernatorial campaign. In response, Whitman vowed to eliminate any potential conflicts of interest, and publicly stated that she would immediately sell her Goldman Sachs stock and put her Goldman Sachs-managed investments in a [[blind trust]] if elected governor. ==Political positions== While running for governor, Whitman emphasized three major areas: job creation, reduced state government spending, and reform of the state's K-12 educational system. She argued that it is best to start only a few things and finish them, instead of starting a lot of things and finishing few of them.{{cite news|author=McLaughlin, Ken|title=Campbell takes Silicon Valley in new San Jose State poll|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/california-governors-race-2010/ci_13802741|work=San Jose Mercury News|date=November 16, 2009|accessdate=December 26, 2009}} ===Environment=== Whitman said that if elected, on her first day{{cite news|author=Gardner, Michael|title=Emissions initiative in Whitman's cross hairs|url=http://www3.signonsandiego.com/stories/2009/oct/05/emissions-initiative-whitmans-cross-hairs/|date=October 5, 2009|work=San Diego Union Tribune|accessdate=October 5, 2009}} she would have suspended AB 32, the [[Global Warming Solutions Act of 2006]], for a year to study its potential economic implications.{{cite news|url=http://www3.signonsandiego.com/stories/2009/sep/24/whitman-says-shed-suspend-8216green8217-initiative/|title=Whitman says she'd suspend 'green' initiative|date=September 24, 2009|work=San Diego Union Tribune|accessdate=September 24, 2009}} AB 32 requires the state to cut [[greenhouse gas emissions]] by 30 percent by 2020. At the state Republican Convention in March 2010, Whitman described California Republican Governor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]]'s climate change bill as a "job-killer".Marinucci, Carla & Garofoli, Joe{{cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2010/03/14/MNI91CFEOE.DTL&sfgabt=ttmabtctopstories|title=Lots of tough talk at state GOP convention|date=March 14, 2010|work=San Francisco Chronicle|accessdate=March 15, 2010 | first1=Carla | last1=Marinucci | first2=Joe | last2=Garofoli}} Whitman opposed [[California Proposition 23 (2010)|Proposition 23]], which would delay the global warming law AB 32 until California's unemployment falls to 5.5 percent and stays there for a year, stating that the proposition did not reasonably balance the need to protect jobs with the need to preserve environment.{{cite news|author=Young, Samantha |agency=Associated Press|title=Whitman opposes measure delaying Calif climate law|url=http://www.businessweek.com/ap/financialnews/D9IDQKD80.htm|publisher=Bloomberg|work=BusinessWeek |accessdate=September 24, 2010}} On water issues, Whitman opposed further restrictions on water supply in the [[Central Valley (California)|Central Valley]], and she suggested that President Obama should overturn a federal judge's ruling under provisions in the [[Endangered Species Act]] which reduced water supplies another 5% to 7%.[http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20100820032423/http://www.megwhitman.com/story/202/meg-whitman-let-the-water-flow.html "Meg Whitman: Let the water flow"]. ''Fresno Bee''. June 12, 2009 ===Illegal immigration=== Whitman said that [[Arizona]]'s approach to illegal immigration with [[Support Our Law Enforcement and Safe Neighborhoods Act|Arizona SB 1070]] is wrong and that there are better ways to solve the problem.{{Cite news| url =https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2010/10/whitman-in-spanish-im-against-arizonas-law/65236/|title=Whitman in Spanish: I'm Against Arizona's Law|first=Chris |last=Good|publisher=[[The Atlantic]] |date =October 26, 2010}} She said that, if she had lived in California in 1994, she would have voted against [[California Proposition 187 (1994)|Proposition 187]] concerning illegal immigrants. {{Cite news|last=Dibble|first=Sandra|title=Path to legalization needed, GOP candidate Whitman says|newspaper=[[The San Diego Union-Tribune]]|location=San Diego, California|date=October 29, 2009|url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/2009/oct/29/path-citizenship-needed-gop-candida/}} In an op-ed during her gubernatorial campaign, Whitman wrote, "Clearly, when examining our positions on immigration, there is very little over which Jerry Brown and I disagree".{{cite web|title=Meg Whitman op-ed: Brown and I the same on immigration|work=Sacramento Bee|date=July 14, 2010|url=http://blogs.sacbee.com/capitolalertlatest/2010/07/meg-whitman-in-op-ed-brown-and.html|accessdate=August 9, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100825004851/http://blogs.sacbee.com/capitolalertlatest/2010/07/meg-whitman-in-op-ed-brown-and.html|archivedate=August 25, 2010|df=mdy-all}} She stated that illegal immigrant students should be prohibited from attending state-funded institutions of higher education.[https://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/19/us/politics/19whitman.html New York Times, June 18, 2010, "The Ad Campaign"]{{cite web|url=http://connection.ebscohost.com/c/speeches/44962052/meg-whitman-governor-california |title=Policy Pages – Other Priorities – Meg Whitman for Governor of California |publisher=Megwhitman.com |accessdate=August 29, 2010}} Currently, California state law permits this.[http://www.sacbee.com/2010/04/01/2648006/illegal-immigrants-less-than-1.html The Sacramento Bee, "Illegal immigrants college enrollment", August 6, 2010] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100510205149/http://www.sacbee.com/2010/04/01/2648006/illegal-immigrants-less-than-1.html |date=May 10, 2010 }} In 2009, Whitman called for "a path to legalization" of illegal immigrants. In a 2010 interview on television station [[KTLA]], Whitman said, "I want to hold employers accountable for hiring only documented workers."{{cite web| title = In Case You Missed It: Meg Whitman's interview on KTLA| publisher=Meg Whitman for Governor| date = August 11, 2010| url = http://www.megwhitman.com/story/9561/in-case-you-missed-it-meg-whitmans-interview-on-ktla.html| archive-url = http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20100819214258/http://www.megwhitman.com/story/9561/in-case-you-missed-it-meg-whitmans-interview-on-ktla.html| dead-url = yes| archive-date = August 19, 2010| accessdate =October 11, 2010 }} ===Marriage, abortion and marijuana=== During the 2010 California gubernatorial election, Whitman supported California's [[California Proposition 8 (2008)|Proposition 8]], which reversed ''[[In re Marriage Cases]]'' and defined marriage as a union between one man and one woman in the state. Whitman also criticized Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger and [[California Attorney General|Attorney General]] Jerry Brown for not defending Proposition 8 in the federal judicial system.{{cite news|author1=Marinucci, Carla |author2=Garofoli, Joe |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2010/08/20/MNKU1F18TF.DTL |title=Meg Whitman says state should defend Prop. 8 |work=San Francisco Chronicle |date=August 21, 2010 |accessdate=August 29, 2010}} However, on February 26, 2013, Whitman confirmed that she had reversed that opinion. Whitman stated, "At the time, I believed the people of California had weighed in on this question and that overturning the will of the people was the wrong approach," and "The facts and arguments presented during the legal process since then have had a profound impact on my thinking."{{cite news|title=Meg Whitman signs legal brief backing gay marriage in Prop. 8 case|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2013/02/meg-whitman-signs-legal-brief-supporting-gay-marriage-in-prop-8-case.html|accessdate=February 27, 2013|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=February 26, 2013}} Whitman also believes that gay and lesbian couples should be permitted to adopt children.{{cite news|author=Finnegan, Michael|title=GOP gubernatorial candidate Whitman outlines stands|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-whitman11-2009feb11,0,5416436.story|date=February 11, 2009|work=Los Angeles Times|publisher=Tribune Company|accessdate=February 22, 2009}} Whitman supports [[abortion rights]].{{cite news|author=Marinucci, Carla|title=Meg Whitman makes case on how she's different|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2009/02/12/BACU15SUDJ.DTL|date=February 13, 2009|work=San Francisco Chronicle|accessdate=February 22, 2009}} Whitman has said that the legalization of [[marijuana]] is not what any law enforcement person would suggest for any reason and that "this is the worst idea [she has] ever seen."{{cite news|title=Meg Whitman to speak in Seal Beach|url=http://www.scpr.org/news/2010/03/16/13041/meg-whitman-speak-seal-beach/|date=March 16, 2010|accessdate=April 7, 2014}} ===Infrastructure=== Whitman does not support the proposed and partially voter-funded [[California High-Speed Rail]] project. In a letter to the ''[[Sacramento Bee]]''{{cite news|url=http://www.sacbee.com/2010/07/09/2878527/the-buzz-atherton-resident-meg.html |title=The Buzz: Atherton resident Meg Whitman not too keen on bullet train |work=Sacramento Bee |accessdate=October 24, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100719210211/http://www.sacbee.com/2010/07/09/2878527/the-buzz-atherton-resident-meg.html |archivedate=July 19, 2010 |df= }} Whitman's spokeswoman Sarah Pompei said, "Meg believes the state cannot afford the costs associated with high-speed rail due to our current fiscal crisis." Her opponent Jerry Brown is in favor of the project. Whitman has made monetary donations to various candidates and [[political action committee]]s (PAC). While these have gone to both [[Republican Party (United States)|Republicans]] and [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]], the donations are weighted to Republicans.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsmeat.com/ceo_political_donations/Meg_Whitman.php|title=Meg Whitman at|publisher=Newsmeat.com|date=May 19, 2010|accessdate=May 27, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100205142144/http://newsmeat.com/ceo_political_donations/Meg_Whitman.php|archivedate=February 5, 2010|df=mdy-all}} Though Whitman has contributed to a few Democrats, including Senator [[Barbara Boxer]]; donating $4,000 to her campaign and serving on the "Friends of Boxer" committee in 2004, she donated more than $225,000 during the same period to Republicans, eBay's PAC and to Americans for a Republican Majority, the PAC of former [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] [[Tom DeLay]].{{cite web|last=Weigel|first=David|url=http://washingtonindependent.com/62382/meg-whitmans-donations-barbara-boxer-tom-delay|title=Washingtonindependent.com|publisher=Washingtonindependent.com|accessdate=May 27, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100525004150/http://washingtonindependent.com/62382/meg-whitmans-donations-barbara-boxer-tom-delay|archivedate=May 25, 2010|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news|last=Marinucci|first=Carla|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/nov05election/detail?entry_id=48814#ixzz0Wx4GvMLs|title=''San Francisco Chronicle''|work=San Francisco Chronicle |date=October 2, 2009|accessdate=May 27, 2010}} == Awards == In 2017, Whitman was the Commencement speaker for [[Carnegie Mellon University]] and was awarded an honorary doctorate degree.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cmu.edu/news/stories/archives/2017/april/whitman-commencement-speaker.html|title=Meg Whitman Named Commencement Speaker - News - Carnegie Mellon University|last=University|first=Carnegie Mellon|date=2017-04-13|work=|access-date=2018-09-21|language=en}} ==See also== *[[List of richest American politicians]] *[[Stop Trump movement]] Inc.|date=Oct 6, 2014|publisher=StockNewsDesk}} {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==Further reading== *{{Cite book|last=Whitman|first=Meg|title=The Power of Many|publisher=Crown|location=San [[File:Test Modified Atmosphere.jpg|right|thumb|250px|Testing the atmosphere in a [[plastic bag]] of carrots]]
'''Modified atmosphere''' is the practice of modifying the composition of the internal atmosphere of a [[package testing|package]] (commonly food packages, drugs, etc.) in order to improve the [[shelf life]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=Principles and applications of modified atmosphere packaging of foods|last=Parry|first=R. T.|publisher=Springer US|year=1993|isbn=9781461358923|location=Boston, MA|pages=|oclc=840284063}}</ref>The need for this technology for food arises from the short shelf life of food products such as meat, fish, poultry, and dairy in the presence of oxygen. In food, oxygen is readily available for [[lipid oxidation]] reactions. Oxygen also helps maintain high [[Respiration rate|respiration rates]] of fresh produce, which contribute to shortened shelf life.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Frying of food : oxidation, nutrient and non-nutrient antioxidants, biologically active compounds and high temperatures|last=Boskou, D., Elmadfa, I.|first=|publisher=CRC Press|year=2011|isbn=9781439806821|edition=2nd|location=Boca Raton|pages=|oclc=466361000}}</ref> From a microbiological aspect, oxygen encourages the growth of [[Cellular respiration#Aerobic respiration|aerobic]] [[Decomposition|spoilage]] [[Microorganism|microorganisms]].<ref name=":0" /> Therefore, the reduction of oxygen and its replacement with other gases can reduce or delay oxidation reactions and microbiological spoilage. Oxygen scavengers may also be used to reduce browning due to lipid oxidation by halting the auto-oxidative chemical process.
The modification process generally lowers the amount of [[oxygen]] (O<sub>2</sub>) in the headspace of the package. Oxygen can be replaced with [[nitrogen]] (N<sub>2</sub>), a comparatively inert gas, or [[carbon dioxide]] (CO<sub>2</sub>).<ref name=":0" />
A stable atmosphere of gases inside the packaging can be achieved using active techniques, such as gas flushing and compensated vacuum, or passively by designing “breathable” films.
== History == The first recorded beneficial effects of using modified atmosphere date back to 1821. Jacques Etienne Berard, a professor at the School of Pharmacy in Montpellier, France, reported delayed ripening of fruit and increased shelf life in low-oxygen storage conditions.<ref name=":6">{{Cite journal|last=Kirtil, E and Oztop, M.H.|first=|date=2016|title=Controlled and modified atmosphere packaging|url=|journal=Reference Module in Food Science|volume=|pages=|doi=10.1016/B978-0-08-100596-5.03376-X|via=}}</ref> [[Controlled atmosphere|Controlled Atmosphere]] Storage (CAS) was used from the 1930's when ships transporting fresh apples and pears had high levels of CO<sub>2</sub> in their holding rooms in order to increase the shelf life of the product.<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|title=Principles and applications of modified atmosphere packaging of foods|last=Blakistone|first=B.A.|publisher=Blackie Academic & Professional|year=1998|isbn=0751403601|edition=2nd|location=London|pages=1-38}}</ref> In the 1970s MA packages reached the stores when bacon and fish were sold in retail packs in Mexico. Since then development has been continuous and interest in MAP has grown due to consumer demand.
== Theory == Atmosphere within the package can be modified passively or actively.<ref name=":5">{{Cite book|title=Food Packaging Principles and Practice (2nd ed)|last=Robertson|first=G.L.|publisher=CRC Press|year=2006|isbn=0-8493-3775-5|location=Florida|pages=313-330}}</ref> In passive modified atmosphere packaging (MAP), the high concentration of CO<sub>2</sub> and low O<sub>2</sub> levels in the package is achieved over time as a result of respiration of the product and gas transmission rates of the packaging film. This method is commonly used for fresh respiring fruits and vegetables. Reducing O<sub>2</sub> and increasing CO<sub>2</sub> slows down respiration rate, conserves stored energy, and therefore extended shelf life.<ref name=":52">{{Cite book|title=Modified atmosphere packaging for fresh-cut fruits and vegetables|last=Brody, A.L., Zhuang, H.|first=Han, J.H|publisher=Blackwell Publishing Ltd|year=2011|isbn=978-0-8138-1274-8|location=West Sussex, UK|pages=57-67}}</ref> On the other hand, active MA involves the use of active systems such as O<sub>2</sub> and CO<sub>2</sub> scavengers or emitters, moisture absorbers, ethylene scavengers, ethanol emitters and gas flushing in the packaging film or container to modify the atmosphere within the package.<ref name=":52" />
The mixture of gases selected for a MAP package depends on the type of product, the packaging materials and the storage temperature. The atmosphere in an MA package consists mainly of adjusted amounts of N<sub>2</sub>, O<sub>2</sub>, and CO<sub>2.</sub><ref name=":5" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite book|title=Food processing technology: principles and practice (4th ed)|last=Fellows, P.J|first=|publisher=Woodhead Publishing|year=2017|isbn=978-0-08-101907-8|location=Duxford, UK|pages=992-1001}}</ref> Reduction of O<sub>2</sub> promotes delay in deteriorative reactions in foods such as [[Lipid peroxidation|lipid oxidation]], [[Food browning|browning reactions]] and growth of spoilage organisms.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":5" /> Low O<sub>2</sub> levels of 3-5% are used to slow down respiration rate in fruits and vegetables.<ref name=":5" /> In the case of red meat, however, high levels of O<sub>2</sub> (∼80%) are used to reduce oxidation of [[myoglobin]] and maintain an attractive bright red color of the meat.<ref name=":622">{{Cite journal|last=Djenane, D.|first=Roncales, P.|date=2018|title=Carbon monoxide in meat and fish packaging: advantages and limits|url=|journal=Foods|volume=7|pages=|via=DOI: 10.3390/foods7020012}}</ref> Meat color enhancement is not required for pork, poultry and cooked meats; therefore, a higher concentration of CO<sub>2</sub> is used to extend the shelf life.<ref name=":3" /> Levels higher than 10% of CO<sub>2</sub> are phytotoxic for fruit and vegetables, so CO<sub>2</sub> is maintained below this level. N<sub>2</sub> is mostly used as a filler gas to prevent pack collapse.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" /> In addition, it is also used to prevent oxidative rancidity in packaged products such as snack foods by displacing atmospheric air, especially oxygen, therefore extending shelf life.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" /> The use of noble gases such as [[Helium]] (He), [[Argon]] (Ar) and [[Xenon]] (Xe) to replace N<sub>2</sub> as the balancing gas in MAP can also be used to preserve and extend the shelf life of fresh and minimally processed fruits and vegetables. Their beneficial effects are due to their higher solubility and diffusivity in water, making them more effective in displacing O<sub>2</sub> from cellular sites and enzymatic O<sub>2</sub> receptors.<ref name=":4">{{Cite journal|last=Ghidelli, C|first=Perez-Gago, M.B|date=2018|title=Recent advances in modified atmosphere packaging and edible coatings to maintain quality of fresh-cut fruits and vegetables.|url=|journal=Critical Reviews in Food Science and Nutrition|volume=58|pages=662-679|via=DOI:10.1080/10408398.2016.1211087}}</ref>
There has been a debate regarding the use of [[carbon monoxide]] (CO) in the packaging of red meat due to its possible toxic effect on packaging workers.<ref name=":622" /> Its use results in a more stable red color of carboxymyoglobin in meat, which leads to another concern that it can mask evidence of spoilage in the product.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":622" />
== Effect on microorganisms == Low O<sub>2</sub> and high CO<sub>2</sub> concentrations in packages are effective in limiting the growth of Gram negative bacteria, molds and aerobic microorganisms, such as ''[[Pseudomonas]]'' spp. High O<sub>2</sub> combined with high CO<sub>2</sub> could have bacteriostatic and bactericidal effects by suppression of [[Aerobic organism|aerobes]] by high CO<sub>2</sub> and [[Anaerobic organism|anaerobes]] by high O<sub>2</sub>.<ref name=":4" /> CO<sub>2</sub> has the ability to penetrate bacterial membrane and affect intracellular pH. Therefore, lag phase and generation time of spoilage microorganisms are increased resulting in shelf life extension of refrigerated foods.<ref name=":622" /> Since the growth of spoilage microorganisms are suppressed by MAP, the ability of the pathogens to grow is potentially increased. Microorganisms that can survive under low oxygen environment such as ''[[Campylobacter jejuni]]'', ''[[Clostridium botulinum]]'', ''[[Escherichia coli|E. coli]]'', ''[[Salmonella]]'', ''[[Listeria]]'' and ''[[Aeromonas hydrophila|Aeromonas hydophila]]'' are of major concern for MA packaged products.<ref name=":52" /> Products may appear [[Organoleptic|organoleptically]] acceptable due to the delayed growth of the spoilage microorganisms but might contain harmful [[Pathogen|pathogens]].<ref name=":52" /> This risk can be minimized by use of additional hurdles such as temperature control (maintain temperature below 3 degrees C), lowering water activity (less than 0.92), reducing pH (below 4.5) or addition or preservatives such as nitrite to delay metabolic activity and growth of pathogens.<ref name=":3" />
== Packaging materials == Flexible films are commonly used for products such as fresh produce, meats, fish and bread seeing as they provide suitable permeability for gases and water vapor to reach the desired atmosphere. Pre-formed trays are formed and sent to the food packaging facility where they are filled. The package headspace then undergoes modification and sealing. Pre-formed trays are usually more flexible and allow for a broader range of sizes as opposed to thermoformed packaging materials as different tray sizes and colors can be handled without the risk of damaging the package.<ref name=":2">{{Cite book|url=http://doi.wiley.com/10.1002/9781444392180.ch10|title=Food and Beverage Packaging Technology|last=Mullan|first=Michael|last2=McDowell|first2=Derek|date=2011-03-17|publisher=Wiley-Blackwell|isbn=9781444392180|location=Oxford, UK|pages=263–294|language=en|doi=10.1002/9781444392180.ch10}}</ref> Thermoformed packaging however is received in the food packaging facility as a roll of sheets. Each sheet is subjected to heat and pressure, and is formed at the packaging station. Following the forming, the package is filled with the product, and then sealed.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Schmidt|first=F|date=2003-12-20|title=Modelling of infrared heating of thermoplastic sheet used in thermoforming process|url=http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0924013603002917|journal=Journal of Materials Processing Technology|volume=143-144|pages=225–231|doi=10.1016/s0924-0136(03)00291-7|issn=0924-0136}}</ref> The advantages that thermoformed packaging materials have over pre-formed trays are mainly cost-related: thermoformed packaging uses 30% to 50% less material, and they are transported as rolls of material. This will amount in significant reduction of manufacturing and transportation costs.<ref name=":2" />
When selecting packaging films for MAP of fruits and vegetables the main characteristics to consider are gas permeability, water vapour transmission rate, mechanical properties, transparency, type of package and sealing reliability.<ref name=":5" /> Traditionally used packaging films like [[LDPE]] (low-density polyethylene), [[Polyvinyl chloride|PVC]] (polyvinyl chloride), [[Ethylene-Vinyl Acetate|EVA]] (ethylene-vinyl acetate) and OPP (oriented [[polypropylene]]) are not permeable enough for highly respiring products like fresh-cut produce, mushrooms and broccoli. As fruits and vegetables are respiring products, there is a need to transmit gases through the film. Films designed with these properties are called [[permeable film]]s. Other films, called barrier films, are designed to prevent the exchange of gases and are mainly used with non-respiring products like meat and fish.
MAP films developed to control the humidity level as well as the gas composition in the sealed package are beneficial for the prolonged storage of fresh fruits, vegetables and herbs that are sensitive to moisture. These films are commonly referred to as [[modified atmosphere/modified humidity packaging]] (MA/MH)films.
== Equipment == In using form-fill-seal packaging machines, the main function is to place the product in a flexible pouch suitable for the desired characteristics of the final product. These pouches can either be pre-formed or thermoformed. The food is introduced into the pouch, the composition of the headspace atmosphere is changed within the package; it is then heat sealed.<ref name=":2" /> These types of machines are typically called pillow-wrap, which horizontally or vertically form, fill and seal the product.<ref name=":1" /> Form-fill-seal packaging machines are usually used for large scale operations.
In contrast, chamber machines are used for batch processes. A filled pre-formed wrap is filled with the product and introduced into a cavity. The cavity is closed and vacuum is then pulled on the chamber and the modified atmosphere is inserted as desired. Sealing of the package is done through heated sealing bars, and the product is then removed. This batch process is labor intensive and thus requires a longer period of time; however, it is relatively cheaper than packaging machines which are automated.<ref name=":2" />
Additionally, snorkel machines are used to modify the atmosphere within a package after the food has been filled. The product is placed in the packaging material and positioned into the machine without the need of a chamber. A nozzle, which is the snorkel, is then inserted into the packaging material. It pulls a vacuum and then flushes the modified atmosphere into the package. The nozzle is removed and the package is heat sealed. This method is suitable for bulk and large operations.<ref name=":2" />
== Products == Many products such as red meat, seafood, minimally processed fruits and vegetables, salads, pasta, cheese, bakery goods, poultry, cooked and cured meats, ready meals and dried foods are packaged under MA.<ref name=":6" /> A summary of optimal gas mixtures for MA products are shown in Table 1.
Table 1. Modified Atmosphere Packaging for different food products and optimal gas mixtures<ref name=":0" /> {| class="wikitable" |- ! Product !! Oxygen (%) !! Carbon Dioxide (%) !! Nitrogen (%) |- | Red Meat || 80 - 85 || 15 || - |- | Poultry || 25 || 75 || - |- | Fish || - || 60 || 40 |- | Soft Cheeses || - || 100 || - |- | Hard Cheeses ||- || 100 || - |- | Bread || 70 || 30 || - |- | Fresh Pasta || - || - || 100 |- | Fruits and Vegetables || 3 - 5|| 3 - 5 || 85 - 95 |- |}
== See also == * [[Active packaging]] * [[Cold chain]] * [[Modified atmosphere/modified humidity packaging]] * [[Permeation]] * [[Shelf life]]
== Citations == <references />
== References == * Church, I.J. & Parsons, A.L.: (1995) Modified Atmosphere Packaging Technology: A Review, Journal Science Food Agriculture, 67, 143-152 * Day, B.P.F.: (1996) A perspective of modified atmosphere packaging of fresh produce In Western Europe, Food Science and Technology Today, 4,215-221 * European Food Information Council (EFIC: (2001) [http://ec.europa.eu/food/fs/sc/scf/out112_en.pdf Opinion of the Scientific Committee on Food on the use of carbon monoxide as component of packaging gases in modified atmosphere packaging for fresh meat]. * Parry, R. T.: (1993) Principles and applications of MAP of foods, Blackie Academic & Professional, England, 1-132 * Phillips, C.A.: (1996) Review: Modified Atmosphere Packaging and its effects on the microbial quality and safety of produce, International Journal of Food Science and Tech, 31, 463-479 * Robertson, G. L., "Food Packaging: Principles and Practice", 3rd edition, 2013, {{ISBN|978-1-4398-6241-4}} * Zagory, D. & Kader, A.A.: (1988) Modified atmosphere packaging of fresh produce, Food Technology., 42(9), 70-77

{{no footnotes|date=May 2017}} [[File:ER Terminal cleaning.jpg|right|250px|thumb|Terminal cleaning at an [[emergency room|ER]] center]]
'''Non-flammable Alcohol Vapor in Carbon Dioxide systems''' ('''NAV-[[carbon dioxide|CO2]] System''') were developed in Japan in the 1990s to sanitize hospitals and ambulances. ==Application== The NAV-CO2 uses CO<sub>2</sub> ([[carbon dioxide]]) as a propellant to dispense a 58% [[isopropyl alcohol]] solution in a heated stream. The procedure uses alcohol in an [[aerosol|atomized vapor]], and reaches nooks, crannies, and crevices that may be beyond the reach of other [[disinfectant|disinfecting]] methods.
==Safety== The use of carbon dioxide as a propellant serves to displace ambient oxygen (one of the elements needed to support combustion) and eliminates the risk of explosion. The carbon dioxide and atomized alcohol evaporate at room temperature leaving no residue.
==References and notes== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.unitedsanitizing.com/index.php/indu/nav-co2-healthcare/ NAV-CO2 in Healthcare]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Nav-Co2 systems}} [[Category:Cleaning tools]] [[Category:Disinfectants]]

[[File:Oil Heater 5293.jpg|thumb|right|A typical oil heater]] [[File:Electricaire Economaster 2400 Electric Oil Heater.jpg|thumb|right|The Electricaire Economaster 2400 electric oil heater]] An '''oil heater''', also known as an '''oil-filled heater''', '''oil-filled radiator''', or '''column heater''', is a common form of [[convector heater|convection heater]] used in domestic [[heating]]. Although filled with [[oil]], it is [[electric heating|electrically heated]] and does not involve burning any oil [[fuel]]; the oil is used as a [[heat reservoir]] (buffer), not as a fuel.
==How it works== Oil heaters consist of metal columns with cavities, inside which a heat transfer oil flows freely around the heater. A [[heating element]] at the base of the heater heats up the oil, which then flows around the cavities of the heater by [[convection]]. The oil has a relatively high [[specific heat capacity]] and high [[boiling point]]. The high specific heat capacity allows the oil to effectively transfer [[thermal energy]] from the heating element, while the oil's high boiling point allows it to remain in the [[liquid phase]] for the purpose of heating, so that the heater does not have to be a [[pressure vessel|high pressure vessel]].
The heating element heats the oil, which transfers heat to the metal wall through convection, through the walls via conduction, then to the surroundings via air convection and thermal radiation. The columns of oil heaters are typically constructed as thin fins, such that the surface area of the metal columns is large relative to the amount of oil and element which provides the heat. A large surface area allows more air to be in contact with the heater at any point in time, allowing for the heat to be transferred more effectively, which results in a surface temperature which is safe enough to touch. The relatively large specific heat capacity of the oil and metal parts means this type of heater takes a few minutes to heat up and cool down, providing a short-term thermal store.
==Efficiency== Although oil heaters are more expensive to run and provide far less spatial heating than [[gas heater]]s, they are still commonly used in bedrooms and other small-to-medium-sized enclosed areas. This is because gas heaters, especially when [[flue|unflued]], are not suitable for bedroom use - gas heaters cannot be used in confined spaces due to the reduced [[oxygen]], and the emissions produced. This leaves electrically powered heaters, such as oil heaters and [[fan heater]]s, as the only alternative.
Several efficiency metrics can be measured in regard to heaters, such as the efficiency of heating a room with a given amount of power, and the efficiency of the [[electrical generator]] which powers the heater and power loss from transporting the electricity over power lines. Measures may also consider how well a heater keeps the temperature of a space above a certain point. Such a measure would find inefficiencies in heating an already warm room. Many heaters (the majority of available models) are equipped with a [[thermostat]] to prevent this inefficient heating, which in turn reduces running costs. This feature was much more common in oil heaters than in the cheaper fan heaters until recently; thus many older oil heaters will be cheaper and more efficient to run than their contemporary fan heaters that lack the thermostat.
Typical oil heaters range in power consumption/output from 300 to 2400 [[watt]]s, and their length and number of columns is roughly proportional to their power rating. A 2400 watt oil heater is usually approximately 1 meter (3.3 feet) in length.
All [[electric heating|electric resistance]] heaters are 100% efficient,<ref>{{cite web|title=Electric resistance heating|url=https://energy.gov/energysaver/electric-resistance-heating|website=ENERGY.GOV|accessdate=12 March 2017}}</ref> with operating costs determined by their wattage and the length of operating time.<ref name=nz>http://www.energywise.govt.nz/products-and-appliances/heating/electric</ref> A 500 watt heater will take twice as long to reach the same thermostat setting as a 1000 watt unit; the total consumption of electricity is the same for both.
By contrast, an electrical [[heat pump]] used for home heating typically has an efficiency well above 100%, expressed as its [[coefficient of performance]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Heat Pumps|url=https://www.energywise.govt.nz/at-home/heating-and-cooling/types-of-heater/heat-pumps/|website=EECA|publisher=EECA|accessdate=12 March 2017}}</ref>
==Safety and features== The primary risk of oil heaters is that of fire and burns. In both regards they are generally more dangerous than [[hydronics]] and [[air conditioning]], but less dangerous than electric fan heaters or [[Electric heating#Radiant heaters|bar radiators]]; this is due to the surface temperature of each type of heater.
Most modern small heaters have some form of tilt sensor to cut power if they are knocked over or placed on an unstable surface. This can reduce the risk of fire if a heater is knocked over.
From a safety standpoint, it is best to avoid having any object within three feet of an oil heater. Using an oil heater to dry clothes is not recommended by any modern manufacturer. There is a substantial fire risk if flammable materials such as clothing or bedding are left near a heater, especially synthetic fabrics such as [[polyester]], which can melt or burn. Even though the surface temperature of the heater in normal operation is quite low, the extra thermal resistance of the clothing on the heater can cause its surface temperature to rise to the material's [[autoignition temperature]]. It should also be noted that some oil heaters contain strong warnings to avoid operation in damp areas (such as bathrooms or laundry rooms) because the moisture and humidity can damage components of the heater itself.
Oil heaters have been known to explode when their thermal fuses fail to shut them off.<ref>{{cite web|title=Oil heater explodes, trial blown|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/southland-times/news/551553|publisher=The Southland Times, New Zealand|accessdate=22 March 2013}}</ref> This can cause fire, thick black smoke, unpleasant odors, oil on walls and other surfaces, and disfiguring scalding.
Some companies offer oil heaters with a fan, to increase the air flow over the heater. Since it is constantly bringing the colder air from the room into contact with the heater, that can improve the rate of heat flow from the heater into the room. The rate of heat flow from the heater into the air in contact with it is higher when there is a greater temperature difference between the heater and the air.
